caption: It is a small museum, outside of Paris. A bit tricky to find, but it is free. I can say that overall feeling of the museum is great, but the art exhibited is kinda just ok.
Great jazz....homage to Miles Davis @ Musee des Avelines
Top

Pretty property in Avelines, gift from the pharmacist owners of St Cloud, Mr Brunet, where the museum is located there today. When there is no exceptional exposure St Cloud porcelain exhibition And on the history of the castle also a concert hall where the acoustics are excellent I invite Clodoaldians to come and visit this museum…. Next exhibition “Henri Regnault”

Museum on the history of the city of Saint-Cloud on two levels with a pretty rotunda in the middle of the building to access the first floor, offers on average two temporary exhibitions per year relating to the city or the people who lived in Saint-Cloud. Cloud like Lino Ventura. Currently exhibiting on Eugène Carriere (until February 16, 2025). The museum is free and also has a tea room, it is surrounded by the Avelines garden and the media library is next door. The train station is about 10 minutes away on foot and buses 160 and 467 stop in front.
A cozy atmosphere for a pleasant stroll between porcelain and paintings.  This is how I would like to be able to enjoy museums and exhibitions. A remarkable welcome.

The place is magnificent, very art deco, located in a pleasant garden. The warm welcome, and the visit to this completely free museum is worth the detour.  The temporary exhibition was superb.  I will come back for the location and the rest of the permanent exhibition.  I warmly recommend!
This magnificent and very interesting museum with its film on the history of the city of Saint Cloud!!!! Very welcoming and professional staff!!! Library and bus stop are nearby!!! Free entry.
Museum dedicated to the history of Saint Cloud. Our guide, Serge Nemirovski, provided us with great explanations in this museum where the Eugène Carrière exhibition is located.

Lots of romantic intimacy in this beautiful exhibition dedicated to Eugène Carrière...the great privilege also for the visitor during the week is the absence of crowds...which allows for real contemplation.
Interesting place to walk, visit and sometimes donate blood. I recommend
It is always pleasant to discover the exhibitions alongside enthusiasts working at the museum.
Pleasant visit to this magnificent museum! We loved it.

This museum is a gem. Very nice surprise! The lady at reception is very kind and welcoming and so are the supervisors. The building is worth seeing, as are the temporary and permanent exhibitions. I have to go back because I haven't finished everything. I was really happy with my visit.
Exceptional Museum! A passionate curator and a team around him who know how to enhance the works, thank you!

In addition to the small permanent collections, the museum this time housed a very pleasant exhibition devoted to Gounod and his numerous relationships with the artists of the time, especially the painters to whom several family ties connect him. It is very nicely presented, on a human scale, and in a very pleasant place. All the museum staff are extraordinarily friendly and helpful. A little moment out of time and daily hassles. And what's more, it's free!
Museum with a restaurant in the center only 2 rooms open but very informative New Expo on October 10 The last fires of the palace. Saint Cloud Aveline museum
Very beautiful exhibition s guide Very good for us too short
Discovered a lovely museum by chance and warm welcome, go there without hesitation

Very warm welcome. This museum is located in the villa built in the 19th century by a pharmacist. Lots of mediation proposals for young and old. The rich past of the city of Saint Cloud is well valued. A small park adjoins the house. Easy to park in the nearby car park.

Quiet, pleasant museum, the exhibition on Napoleon III is interesting. We regret the total absence of the tea room, especially in winter. What a shame not to be able to have even a coffee or tea in the middle of this beautiful living room!

We come regularly to this lovely museum. The exhibitions are always very interesting and well done; From Napoleon III to Lino Ventura via Charles Gounod and René Crevel... See the model of the missing St Cloud castle. And always a very warm welcome.
I loved it, there is a park nearby and we can relax
Interesting temporary exhibition on sports from the beginning of the century in Saint Cloud.
Shades and rustling jets of water in the middle of the city Good place to wait for your appointment time! Still under construction for part
Quite friendly....and many exhibitions.

Free visit to this fabulous residence, both exterior and interior. Fascinating exhibition by René Crevel, originally an architect but also a decorator, porcelain, etc. Symbol of Art Deco. I add that the people who manage all these splendors are attentive and very welcoming. Only shame, very beautiful tea room closed now.
Magnificent museum. Relaxing and very interesting. The staff is very welcoming and available if needed. I love their exhibitions!

Very friendly, the lady at reception was extremely kind and we felt that it is a job that she enjoys doing! We were enchanted by the place. Very nice exhibition also on Princess Palatine, and all this for free and all the staff were smiling and kind! Thank you very much for this pleasant afternoon that we spent at your home.

Top of the top, very pleasant and complete municipal museum on the history of the city! And why not stop by the tea room after the visit? The garden is also pleasant for enjoying a nice quiet afternoon.
I went there on a school trip with my son. Very pretty little museum, very interesting exhibition. The children really enjoyed the little workshop organized.

Small museum, with works by Dantin on the ground floor. I appreciated the Napoleonic evocation with the room dedicated to Napoleon's stays in Saint Cloud. The model allows you to imagine and represent the castle of St Cloud before its fire in 1871. Large portrait of Napoleon III to admire.

Museum small in size and barely visible from the street but large in its collection of letters, sketches, newspapers relating the 18th of Brumaire. Timeless tea room Failing to see the Château de St-Cloud.

It was a fall Sunday at the end of A.M. A temporary exhibition was about to close We visited it at the last minute While two young girls played the piano with four hands. In this green setting, It was enchanting And this museum was all the more endearing.
Magnificent museum, perfectly representative of the city and its history.

January 2022. I no longer wanted to leave the magnificent exhibition of the committed artist Pisano and his moving and wonderfully staged paintings, magnified by the poetry of Frederico Garcia Llorca, interpreted by Paco Ibanez. We love this museum, for the kindness of the lady who welcomes us, the fascinating mediators, the always friendly staff, the richness of its permanent collection and its programming, which is so diverse! From the exhibition on Lino Ventura to the one dedicated to the Canadian Camp in Saint-Cloud...

Free museum mainly focused on the Château de Monsieur and Napoleon 3. Presence of photographs and quite unusual paintings. A small museum which is worth the detour and which is part of a huge park to discover.
Magnificent discovery of a forgotten museum. Superb temporary exhibition on René Crevel, architect, painter and designer from Saint-Cloud.
